title: Pirates of the Caribbean movie
content:
Arrrrrrr!   
I'm wondering if anybody happens to know the font used for the Pirates of the Caribbean movie posters - or any other cool swashbucklin' fonts that would work for me...   
here's a peek at the font... [http://pirates.movies.go.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905090010/http:/pirates.movies.go.com/)

 [‹ Riksgalds Kontoret type id](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905090010/http:/www.typophile.com/node/657 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Shumaker, Loop & Kendrick - Felix Titling {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905090010/http:/www.typophile.com/node/665 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dangerboy

comments.content: I'm looking for the same thing. BTW most of the text on the link you supplied is set in Caslon Antique.
[Mason](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905090010/http:/emigre.com/EF.php?fid=104) was used for a lot of the trailers, etc. I imagine the logo itself is unique.

I'd have a look at [Letterhead Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905090010/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/) and [Scriptorium](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905090010/http:/fontcraft.com/scriptorium/)  
if I were you.   
   
Which I'm not.   
   
But you get my drift. ;)

Here's ITC Blackadder used in something I did for a local band:   
 ![pyrate.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905090010im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/13121.jpg)   
Note the stamp effect--_thanks for the tutorial Yves._
